document.description: When you order, everything is thrown into one bucket and ... model Alicia Douvall is first Cowell kiss and tell ... You won't fit a baby seat in that! Jack Osbourne buys a ...
document.body:

News Home Arts Headlines Pictures Most read News Board
My Profile Logout Login Find a Job M&S;Wine Our Papers Feedback Thursday, Jul 12 2012 9PM 13°C 12AM 14°C 5-Day Forecast It's Obama Fried Chicken! OFC pops up in China... but can the President also match the secret recipe of Colonel Sanders?
By Mike O'brien Created 5:48 AM on 1st October 2011
Comments ( 93 ) Share
Is Obama abandoning his bid for a second term in the White House and is giving Colonel Sanders a run for his money by opening a chain of fried chicken joints?
Now that's change you can't really believe in.
But in Beijing, China, a restaurant is actually calling itself OFC with a logo that looks alarmingly like the President dressed in the colonel's clothes.
Scroll down for video
The presidential eatery: The Obama Fried Chicken restaurant in Beijing
Broad smiles: President Obama and the original master of Southern Fried Chicken Colonel Sanders
The catchphrase underneath, apparently says 'We’re so cool, aren’t we?'
The Obama Fried Chicken could be a response to the U.S. filing a complaint with the World Trade Organization about Chinese tariffs on American chicken exports. More...
Cook up a storm with maillife.co.uk
According to the New York Times, the tariffs affect an industry that employs about 300,000 people and range from 50 to 100 per cent, which means some Chinese importers paid as much as twice the price for American chicken.
Obama obsession? A lookalike of the president was used in an actual for KFC in Hong Kong
Maybe the Chinese have something of an Obama-chicken obsession.
Earlier this year in Hong Kong, an Obama lookalike was employed to advertize KFC.
The restaurant's sign was first spotted by TheShanghaiist.com and picked up by msnbc.com.
There are, of course, New York versions that caused quite a stir.
There is one in Harlem and one in Brooklyn.
Some people have complained the name plays into old racial stereotypes.
Controversial: The Obama Fried Chicken joint in the Brownsville section of Brooklyn has been accused of racial stereotyping
Selling point: Obama's name also made it way on to the awning of this fast food joint in Harlem, New York

Comments ( 93 )
Here's what other readers have said. Why not debate this issue live on our message boards.
The comments below have not been moderated.
Newest Oldest Best rated Worst rated View all I would rather eat my own warm, fresh vomit than touch anything with that guy's name on it.
- Robert Power, Las Vegas, Nevada, USA, 04/10/2011 02:21 Click to rate Rating 13 Report abuse
At least he will have somewhere to go where he is welcome after the 2012 elections.
- Zapata, Canada, 03/10/2011 22:16 Click to rate Rating 16 Report abuse
When you order, everything is thrown into one bucket and you must buy it before you know what's in it and it just too bad for you if you don't like all left wings!
- Dave , Hamilton OH, 03/10/2011 20:27 Click to rate Rating 54 Report abuse
Do you suppose they have an ongoing special on"Left Wings"?
- Winston Smith, Blountsville, AL, 03/10/2011 19:58 Click to rate Rating 30 Report abuse
I spoke with a friend of mine who is from China and the catchphrase apparently doesn't say:'Were so cool, arent we?'He said it says"Go blow the cow pu*sy."Which is apparently a common phrase for someone who is talking about a bunch of B.S or is lying. He also thinks this is graffiti and not an actual sign.
- Chuck Sanchez, Baton Rouge, LA, 03/10/2011 18:45 Click to rate Rating 12 Report abuse
And comes with a side of what Moochelle Obama calls"How Do You Like Dem Apples?"(Agree to higher taxes and you may elect to have either fried potatoes or 6 minutes without the Obama's all up in your face.)
- Peter, Raleigh, NC, 03/10/2011 17:37 Click to rate Rating 39 Report abuse
Dark meat without a backbone. What a concept!
- Peter, Raleigh, NC, 03/10/2011 17:14 Click to rate Rating 75 Report abuse
Obama is a pop star, not a political leader. Obama Fried Chicken explains his appeal. It's star-based, not reality-based. The guy never held a real job, spent 150 days in the Senate of the US, now thinks he can lead the world. What a joke!!
- Pouncekitty, New York, USA, 03/10/2011 17:10 Click to rate Rating 55 Report abuse
The only problem with Obama Chicken is that there is no chicken, just battered hot air.
- GWIII, Western NY, 03/10/2011 16:24 Click to rate Rating 103 Report abuse
You coulnd't get away with that here in the States, so funny! They already had some frozen Obama Fried Chicken in Germany a couple of years ago. Next: Obama Watermelons.
- Nico, Colorado Springs, 03/10/2011 15:34 Click to rate Rating 50 Report abuse
